name: market for cement, Portland | cement, Portland | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/324/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'cement, Portland', in the geography of Europe without Switzerland.;Transport distances are generated based on default global transport-distances model. Transport, freight, sea, transoceanic ship has been, in case of Europe, excluded.;The product "cement, Portland" represents Ordinary Portland Cement (CEM I). It consists of 95-100% clinker in mass composition. 

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'cement, Portland',  within the geography of Europe without Switzerland.

This activity ends with the supply of 'cement, Portland',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Due to low price, big weight and consumers distribution cement is not traded globally.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale.
